alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 21 at 2:41PM MST until December 24 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in the mountains. 3 to 6 inches are expected near Pinedale and Daniel, with locally higher amounts around 8 inches near Hoback Junction. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West, Salt River and Wyoming Ranges and Upper Green River Basin Foothills. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday through 6 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over South and Salt River Passes. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As snow looks to continue into Friday evening, winter storm highlights may need to be extended to highlight continuing impacts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Wind River Mountains West
